show.title: Elf
show.headline: The best way to spread Christmas cheer

event.title: <show-title>Elf</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A cheerful celebration with themed games, props & singing loud for all to hear
event.description:
"Buddy the Elf, what's your favorite color?"

Don’t be a cotton-headed ninnymuggins this holiday season. Come out to Alamo Drafthouse and spread the cheer at this sugar-fueled, interactive holiday spectacular, packed with games, props, and, of course, singing loud for all to hear.

Bundle up for this celebration of one of the best holiday films ever made, period. Will Ferrell’s take on a North Pole elf trying to figure out Manhattan (“Watch out! The yellow ones don’t stop!”) just might be the funniest he’s ever been.

Our ELF Movie Party features all sorts of fun props, a gift "wrap off" before the film, and of course, your very own elf hat.

titleCardImage.altText: Movie Party TC

show.title: Ghostbusters (1984)
show.headline: Cross the streams into a spectral-blast of fun

event.title: <show-title>Ghostbusters (1984)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Classic movie, interactive props…mass hysteria!
event.description:
For 40 years, GHOSTBUSTERS has held a special place in the hearts of moviegoers with its eye-popping special effects, iconic characters, and, of course, its cast of comedy heavyweights led by Bill Murray. So we want to show our love for this beloved blockbuster by throwing an epically spooky movie party.

We’ll have a bunch of ghostly goodies to help you get in on the fun, including some slime from Slimer himself, some Stay Puft marshmallows, and some glow necklaces you can wave around anytime the Ghostbusters use their proton packs (just don’t cross the streams).

Join us and cheer on Peter, Ray, Egon, and Winston in the fight against the slimy, spooky, supernatural spirits haunting New York City in this hilarious ’80s classic.

show.title: The Rocky Horror Picture Show
show.headline: Do the time warp with us, again

landscapeHeroImage.altText: A53 EGF0 Nz HRG Ku R Itsrt XBM8 FCD

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW portrait

event.title: <show-title>The Rocky Horror Picture Show</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Don’t dream it, be it…at our ROCKY HORROR Movie Party
event.description:
Now, at long last, the antici...pation is over! As the cult of ROCKY HORROR nears its fifth decade, Alamo Drafthouse's celebration of this pioneer of interactive movies has incorporated new breakthroughs, elusive ingredients, and that... SPARK which will make the RHPS experience better than ever!

Now, we know that some ROCKY HORROR screenings can become a little too focused on yelling out those callbacks, so our hosts will make sure we strike a good balance between having some interactive fun while also allowing everyone to enjoy the movie on its own terms.

But we also know that the key to the perfect ROCKY HORROR screening is to have fun and live the movie. With thrilling props (including squirt guns, noisemakers, party hats, inflatable saxophones, and more), the most outrageous callbacks, boisterous sing-alongs, and stimulating pre-show games, our Movie Party will be your ultimate ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW – whether this is your first or 500th viewing.

show.title: Wicked
show.headline: Add our wickedly good, limited-edition lunchbox & thermos to your ticket

event.title: <show-title>Wicked</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Defy gravity at our interactive, magically fun screening
event.description:
Did you know that real magic actually exists? It’s easy to find if you know where to look, namely at our absolutely magical WICKED Movie Party!

Grab your fellow witches and wizards and join us at Shiz University (i.e., your local Alamo Drafthouse) for an unforgettable screening that will make you feel like defying gravity. There’ll be singing, green-tinted glasses, pink bubbles, Shiz University notebooks, and even broom pens (in case you need to make a quick getaway).

So if you’re popular, like dancing through life, and are ready for some fun at dear old Shiz, then don’t miss this wickedly good Movie Party.

show.title: Beetlejuice
show.headline: We dare you to say his name three times

event.title: <show-title>Beetlejuice</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Haunt along with the ghost with the most, babes
event.description:
Betelgeuse, Betelgeuse…BETELGEUSE! Well, we’ve summoned him, guess we might as well throw a Movie Party for him.

BEETLEJUICE is the timeless tale of a ghostly couple and the troublesome “bio-exorcist” they employ to help scare away the living inhabiting their house. It’s megawatt Michael Keaton at his kookiest, Winona Ryder, Alec Baldwin, and Geena Davis at their dreamiest, and vintage Tim Burton from start to finish.

Resurrect the undead fun with spooky props galore and all kinds of delights for the Recently Deceased. This ghoulishly interactive screening comes with Miss Argentina sashes, shrimp keychains, BEETLEJUICE stickers, and even sticky eyeballs. Btw, if you feel an uncontrollable urge to Day-o (the banana song), that’s normal.

show.title: In a Lonely Place
show.headline: Humphrey Bogart stars in a noir classic of suspicion, intrigue, and suspense

event.title: <show-title>In a Lonely Place</show-title>
event.headline: Bogart breaks hearts (and noses) in Nicholas Ray’s devastating Hollywood noir
event.description:
We’re all writing the version of ourselves we want people to see. But sometimes, we write ourselves into a corner. It’s “noir season” here at Queer Film Theory 101; as the nights grow longer and the shadows loom large, we’re in the mood for something a bit tormented. In Nicholas Ray’s IN A LONELY PLACE, loosely adapted from Dorothy Hughes's novel, struggling screenwriter Dixon Steele (Humphrey Bogart) is suspected of murder after a brief encounter with a young woman who has turned up dead. Dix’s violent temperament and outsider tendencies certainly fit the “prime suspect” archetype, but he’s got an alibi: his beautiful new neighbor Laurel Gray (Gloria Graham) witnessed the encounter. What follows is a torrid romance that forces Dix and Laurel to question what they know about themselves, and what they’re willing to sacrifice for love and desire.

But is it queer you ask? Absolutely. First off, the protagonist's name is Dix Steele… Bogart’s coldly masculine loner screams repressed homosexuality. The gender roles in IN A LONELY PLACE are consistently in flux, with Steele more often exhibiting the unhinged and manipulative traits of a “femme fatale” rather than the '50s leading man. This twisted noir unpacks the lies that grow between men and women, the falseness of identity in Hollywood, and the darkness that takes hold when we begin to believe the worst of each other and ourselves. WHEW! Something tells us we’re going to need a stiff drink and a long look in the mirror after this torrid classic. Welcome to Hollywood, kid, hope you survive the experience.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Brood
show.headline: The ultimate experience in inner terror!

event.title: <show-title>The Brood</show-title>
event.headline: The ultimate experience in inner terror!
event.description:
"THE BROOD is my version of KRAMER VS. KRAMER, but more realistic." – David Cronenberg

It’s spooky season, and that means it’s psychotherapy time…or rather “psychoplasmics” time at Queer Film Theory 101! We’re headed out for a little self-reflection at The Somafree Institute of Psychoplasmatics in David Cronenberg’s most personal and serious film THE BROOD from 1979. It’s MARRIAGE STORY on mescaline!

Developed in the wake of Cronenberg’s difficult divorce, THE BROOD is a startling interrogation into cycles of abuse, patriarchy, and the destruction of the nuclear family, complete with tiny murder goblins! Gorgeous Diva Nola Carveth (the iconic Samantha Eggar) is an unstable and traumatized woman undergoing intense and experimental therapy with Dr. Hal Raglan (Oliver Reed giving stunt daddy realness) at his private institute. As a custody battle between Nola and her ineffectual milquetoast ex-husband Frank (Art Hindle) intensifies, strange murders begin to occur, revealing a terrifying and bizarre manifestation of trauma and rage.

Toxic gender roles, parental failure, and pedophobia (fear of children) are all present in THE BROOD, a movie that posits “maybe heterosexuality is bad?” This gorgeous and provocative melodrama was released to both praise and claims of virulent misogyny and gynophobia, leaving its legacy complicated, but we never shy away from complications here at QFT101! No spoilers, but we’re on the woman’s side. Justice for Nola. These men done did her dirty. Come hang out with us for a night of processing and body horror – if you still want to get married and have kids after watching this movie, that is wild. (Micheal Foulk)

DCP courtesy of Janus Films.

show.title: Black Christmas (1974)
show.headline: Bob Clark's immortal holiday slasher, recently restored

event.title: <show-title>Black Christmas (1974)</show-title>
event.headline: The 4K restoration of the immortal holiday classic
event.description: We don't just watch horror movies — we live for them. And at every Terror Tuesday, we join hands to worship at the gore-soaked altar of slash, trash, thrash, and FUN!! This eclectic series spans all centuries, covering everything from seminal horror treasures to undiscovered D.I.Y. monster-blasts. Terror Tuesday is the new ground zero for warming your black heart.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Blood Feast
show.headline: The first-ever splatter film from genre movie maverick Herschell Gordon Lewis

event.title: <show-title>Blood Feast</show-title>
event.headline: The first-ever splatter film from genre movie maverick Herschell Gordon Lewis
event.description:
“Earlier films, from HORROR OF DRACULA to POOR WHITE TRASH, shocked audiences with relatively discriminating displays of violence. But BLOOD FEAST was the first horror film expressly designed with the goal of attracting viewers with gore-soaked set pieces.” – Roger Ebert

The filmography of genre movie maverick Herschell Gordon Lewis brimmed with the mad, macabre, and just downright bizarre. One of the most unhinged of all his directorial efforts – and certainly the most influential – is his original gore-fest BLOOD FEAST, the first-ever splatter film.

Dorothy Fremont is looking to throw a party unlike any other, and she gets just that when the decidedly sinister Fuad Ramses caters the event. Promising to provide her guests with an authentic Egyptian feast, Ramses promptly acquires the necessary ingredients: the body parts of young nubiles.

Featuring a host of stomach-churning gore gags including the infamous “tongue” sequence, BLOOD FEAST more than lives up to its name and remains essential viewing for any self-respecting horror fan. (AGFA)

show.title: Inside (2007)
show.headline: Extreme season’s greetings from France

event.title: <show-title>Inside (2007)</show-title>
event.headline: Extreme season’s greetings from France
event.description: A standout from the 2000s “New French Extremity” wave, INSIDE is a brutal, chilling, and riveting holiday horror experience. Sarah (the intense Alysson Paradis) is a pregnant widow who just wants a quiet night at home on Christmas Eve. But a mysterious figure outside the snow-swept house has other plans. A remarkably layered examination of anxiety that’s strengthened by home invasion thrills, INSIDE is a stylish, gore-soaked nightmare that you won’t soon forget. Joyeux noël!

show.title: Séance (2000)
show.headline: Kurosawa’s bewitching ghost story

event.title: <show-title>Séance (2000)</show-title>
event.headline: Kurosawa’s bewitching ghost story
event.description:
Screening in Japanese with English subtitles

Between CURE and PULSE, there was SÉANCE – an unheralded J-horror haunting from filmmaker Kiyoshi Kurosawa. Junko, a psychic, and her husband Sato, a movie sound engineer, are in a rut. But everything changes when Junko’s powers lead her to a horrifying discovery in the couple’s garage. Shot in two weeks on gritty 16mm film stock and originally made for Japanese television, SÉANCE weaves true crime thrills, supernatural phenomena, and technological angst through a raw tapestry of human (and non-human) emotions. Never screened in North American theaters, this is a bewitching ghost story like no other.

show.title: Southbound
show.headline: Five intertwining tales of terror unfold along an endless desert highway

event.title: <show-title>Southbound</show-title>
event.headline: All paths converge on the highway to hell!
event.description: On a desolate stretch of desert highway, weary travelers – two men on the run from their past, a band on their way to the next gig, a man struggling to get home, a brother in search of his long-lost sister, and a family on vacation – are forced to confront their worst fears and darkest secrets in these interwoven tales of terror and remorse on the open road. (MPI Media)

show.title: The Hunger
show.headline: Nothing human loves forever

event.title: <show-title>The Hunger</show-title>
event.headline: Vamp out with David Bowie
event.description: Before THE CROW and BRAM STOKER'S DRACULA inspired goths the world over, there was THE HUNGER – a hyper-stylized vampire triumph from director Tony Scott (TOP GUN, TRUE ROMANCE). The story follows vampire lovers Miriam (Catherine Deneuve) and John (David Bowie) as they feed on victims in NYC nightclubs. But when John begins to physically deteriorate, Miriam seduces Sarah (Susan Sarandon), a doctor who may or may not hold the key to their destruction. A chilling art-horror film that sparkles with early MTV vibes, skin-tight black leather, and gorgeous humans, THE HUNGER is an essential snapshot of 1980s decadence.

show.title: The Masque of the Red Death
show.headline: A prince terrorizes local peasants while taking refuge against the plague

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE MASQUE OF THE RED DEATH

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE MASQUE OF THE RED DEATH

posterImages.altText: THE MASQUE OF THE RED DEATH

event.title: <show-title>The Masque of the Red Death</show-title>
event.headline: A prince terrorizes local peasants while taking refuge against the plague
event.description: Nobody wears a pair of tights like Vincent Price. With THE MASQUE OF THE RED DEATH, Price and director Roger Corman solidified a creative blood pact over the works of Edgar Allan Poe that will never be surpassed. In this seventh – and best – of eight collaborations, Price plays Prince Prospero, a loveable rat bastard who finds that his castle has become a refuge for peasants that are damned by a plague called the Red Death. Of course, this can only lead to torture, murder, and mod superstar Jane Asher running rampant through sets that look like they escaped from Mario Bava’s darkest nightmares. THE MASQUE OF THE RED DEATH cuddles us with an intense wickedness while providing a backdrop for Price to scold, scoff, and gouge his way through one of the most iconic and unstoppable performances of his career. And the best part? They do it all for Satan. (Joseph A. Ziemba)

show.title: Trick 'r Treat
show.headline: Poison, drowning, claw, or knife. So many ways to take a life.

event.title: <show-title>Trick 'r Treat</show-title>
event.headline: Four creepy interwoven tales that celebrate the season and spirit of Halloween
event.description: Before Michael Doughtery was scarring Christmas memories with his holiday horror classic KRAMPUS or ushering in kaiju carnage in GODZILLA: KING OF THE MONSTERS, the writer/director burst into the hearts of horror fans with his Halloween-based anthology TRICK ‘R TREAT. Weaving together stories about killers, monsters, ghosts, and ghouls, Doughtery’s movie is a tongue-in-cheek, gleefully scary celebration of the season that stars Anna Paquin, Brian Cox, Dylan Baker, and a pumpkin-headed lil monster named Sam.

show.title: V/H/S/2
show.headline: Who's tracking you?

event.title: <show-title>V/H/S/2</show-title>
event.headline: The found footage anthology sensation
event.description:
Searching for a missing student, two private investigators break into his abandoned house and find another collection of mysterious VHS tapes. In viewing the horrific contents of each cassette, they realize there may be terrifying motives behind the student’s disappearance. Featuring segments directed by Adam Wingard & Simon Barrett, (THE GUEST), Jason Eisener (HOBO WITH A SHOTGUN), Timo Tjahjanto & Gareth Evans (THE RAID), and Eduardo Sánchez & Gregg Hale (THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT).

DCP courtesy of Magnolia Pictures & Magnet Releasing

show.title: XX
show.headline: An all female horror anthology

event.title: <show-title>XX</show-title>
event.headline: Four deadly tales from four female filmmakers
event.description:
We wrap up our month-long spotlight on anthology films with the all-femme rager XX. Featuring the combined talents of Roxanne Benjamin (SOUTHBOUND, V/H/S/2), Annie Clark aka St. Vincent, Karyn Kusama (THE INVITATION), and Jovanka Vuckovic, these bite-sized horror blasts deliver a smorgasbord of genre delights.

DCP courtesy of Magnolia Pictures and Magnet Releasing

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Birth
show.headline: Nicole Kidman's most adventurous role to-date

event.title: <show-title>Birth</show-title>
event.headline: Nicole Kidman's most adventurous role to-date
event.description:
Ten years after her husband suddenly died, Anna (Nicole Kidman) has finally restarted her life and accepted a marriage proposal from her boyfriend. At the engagement party, a stranger wanders in to announce that he's Anna's dead husband. That stranger is a ten-year-old boy. Against her better judgment, Anna decides to hear him out.

Arguably the apex of a stretch of roles proving her to be the most adventurous movie star of her generation, Nicole Kidman gives a pitch-perfect performance in the chilly world Jonathan Glazer creates in BIRTH. (Mike Keegan)

35mm print courtesy of Park Circus

show.title: Blood for Dracula
show.headline: The high art '70s Euroshocker returns.

event.title: <show-title>Blood for Dracula</show-title>
event.headline: The high art '70s Euroshocker returns.
event.description:
“It has obvious appeal for the lover of Grand Guignol, but it equally addresses the thoughtful.” — Maurice Yacowar, THE CRITERION COLLECTION

Immediately after completing FLESH FOR FRANKENSTEIN, filmmaker Paul Morrissey and star Udo Kier created BLOOD FOR DRACULA, a sumptuously depraved Euroshocker that tows the line between art and bad taste. Desperate for virgin blood, Count Dracula (Kier) journeys to an Italian villa only to discover the family’s three young daughters are also coveted by the estate’s Marxist stud (Joe Dallesandro of Morrissey’s FLESH, TRASH, and HEAT). Stefania Casini (SUSPIRIA) and BICYCLE THIEVES director Vittorio De Sica co-star in one of the most unique and outrageous vampire films in history, now scanned uncut in 4K from the original negative for the first time ever.

DCP courtesy of Vinegar Syndrome and the American Genre Film Archive.

show.title: Dark Angel: The Ascent
show.headline: Biblical punishment is a girl's best friend

event.title: <show-title>Dark Angel: The Ascent</show-title>
event.headline: Biblical punishment is a girl's best friend
event.description:
Somewhere between the willful provocation of FORBIDDEN ZONE and FREEWAY's fractured fairytale, writer/general madman Matthew Bright saw fit to deliver unto us DARK ANGEL: THE ASCENT. The second of Bright's scripts for Full Moon Studios, DARK ANGEL follows the young demoness Veronica as she strives to break free from her dogmatic existence punishing sinners in Hell, seeking a more fulfilling life among the humans above. Playing out like a Biblically-accurate adaptation of THE LITTLE MERMAID with more Doc Martens and spine removals, DARK ANGEL is the supernatural romance your inner neurodivergent-coded goth girl didn't know she needs. (Morgan Hyde)

Presentation courtesy of Full Moon Entertainment

show.title: Doppelganger
show.headline: Drew times two?

event.title: <show-title>Doppelganger</show-title>
event.headline: Drew times two?
event.description:
They say everyone has an exact double somewhere out there in the world. What if yours was in the same city and was a homicidal succubus? That’s the basic premise for the “is she or isn’t she” thrills of DOPPELGANGER, but any expectations of genre normalcy or comfort zones are thrown out the window in this underappreciated gonzo movie with outstanding lead performances from teenaged Drew Barrymore (in two roles…or is it one?) and George Newbern as a character cheekily named Patrick Highsmith. (Laird Jimenez)

Presentation courtesy of Park Circus

show.title: Phase IV
show.headline: Welcome your new insect overlords!

event.title: <show-title>Phase IV</show-title>
event.headline: Welcome your new insect overlords!
event.description:
PHASE IV is prolific designer Saul Bass’ sole feature film as director, and its classic status stands as a testament to his talent. When ants begin to build unusual structures in the Arizona desert, a team of scientists set up a research station to try and learn more about this sudden change in insect behavior. A masterclass in tone and balancing ambiguity, speculative fiction, and science-fact, PHASE IV is an eerie experience that dips into cosmic horror and existential philosophy. Incredible macro photography of actual ants and Bass’ eye for design make this an event not to be missed on the big screen.

DCP courtesy of Paramount Pictures

show.title: The Time Masters
show.headline: French pulp psych-animation, newly restored

event.title: <show-title>The Time Masters</show-title>
event.headline: French pulp psych-animation, newly restored
event.description:
Presented in French with English subtitles

Directed by visionary science-fiction animator René Laloux (FANTASTIC PLANET) and designed by the legendary Jean Giraud (a.k.a. Mœbius) THE TIME MASTERS is a visually fantastic foray into existentialist space adventure. After his parents are killed on the dangerous planet Perdide, young Piel (voiced by Frédéric Legros) survives by maintaining radio contact with Jaffar (Jean Valmont), a pilot transporting the exiled Prince Matton (Yves-Marie Maurin) and Princess Belle (Monique Thierry) from their former kingdom. Jaffar seeks the help of Silbad (Michel Elias), a cheerful old-timer who knows how to circumvent Perdide’s hazards, including brain-devouring insects and watery graves. Along the way, Jaffar and company encounter a pair of impish homunculi stowaways, identity-less angels controlled by an amorphous hive mind, and the Masters of Time, mysterious beings who can bend reality and perhaps reveal to the heroes their secret origins and destinies. (Janus Films)

Restored in 4K in 2023 at the initiative of CITE FILMS in collaboration with the Fondazione Cineteca di Bologna and with the support of the CNC

show.title: Gremlins
show.headline: Your favorite little monsters invade Christmas, yet again

event.title: <show-title>Gremlins</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Wreak havoc mogwai-style at a fun, interactive screening
event.description:
Need another reason to love Christmas? Then look no further than the adorably devious yuletide creature feature GREMLINS! Joe Dante’s iconic holiday misadventure continues to be a pop culture sensation, with its darkly funny story of a small-town guy who receives a furry little creature called a mogwai that ends up multiplying into a swarm of monsters that rip the town to shreds. Frankly, wanton destruction has never been so fun.

At our GREMLINS Movie Party, we won’t let you tear the place apart or ruin our electronics, but we will have all kinds of fun props available to help you get in on the action, including 3D specs you can use to get a new perspective on SNOW WHITE, light-up necklaces, and masks so you can choose #TeamSpike or #TeamGizmo.

We just ask that you follow these few simple rules:

  • Don’t get a mogwai wet.
  • Don’t expose a mogwai to bright light.
  • Don’t feed a mogwai after midnight.
  • Don’t miss our GREMLINS Movie Party.

titleCardImage.altText: Movie Party TC

show.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation
show.headline: Nothing but the best for the Griswold Family Christmas

posterImages.altText: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation movie poster

event.title: <show-title>National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Celebrate the season like an honorary Griswold
event.description:
No one knows how to do vacations like the Griswolds. Sure, their holidays are wild, chaotic, and often fraught with peril, but everyone’s family gatherings are a little stressful, aren’t they? Fortunately, you can just let Clark and the gang shoulder all that stress while you enjoy the ride at our CHRISTMAS VACATION Movie Party.

And this party is a real beaut, with yuletide props like pine tree air fresheners, yellow glow sticks, and ugly neckties to help you feel like you're an honorary Griswold. It’ll be more fun than a membership to the Jelly of the Month Club.

show.title: The Polar Express
show.headline: Journey beyond your imagination in this holiday family favorite

event.title: <show-title>The Polar Express</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: All aboard for an interactive holiday adventure the whole family will love
event.description:
Tickets, please. You can’t attend THE POLAR EXPRESS Movie Party without your ticket. And believe us when we tell you that the conductor (one of many Tom Hankses in this movie) is very particular about it.

Once you and the kiddos come aboard this special holiday movie party, we’ll have all sorts of fun surprises waiting for you, including kid-friendly props like a Santa hat, sleigh bells, and some fun activity sheets for you to take home. (And don’t worry, parents, we’ll be sure to lay down some ground rules so you’re not having to listen to jingle bells the whole time.)

With fun props, tasty treats, and more Tom Hankses than you can shake a candy cane at, THE POLAR EXPRESS Movie Party is a delightful, interactive holiday activity the whole family will love.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
